changeSet.author: bsiri
changeSet.comment: creating a view that helps querying on all the issues reported in an execution because querying EXECUTION and EXECUTION_STEP separately is just a pain in the ass.
changeSet.createView: select exec.execution_id, issue.issue_id from EXECUTION exec inner join ISSUE issue on exec.issue_list_id = issue.issue_list_id UNION select eesteps.execution_id, issue.issue_id from EXECUTION_EXECUTION_STEPS eesteps inner join EXECUTION_STEP estep on eesteps.execution_step_id = estep.execution_step_id inner join ISSUE issue on estep.issue_list_id = issue.issue_list_id

changeSet.author: jsimon, bsiri
changeSet.comment: The table CHART_QUERY aggregates 1..* CHART_MEASURE_COLUMN, 1..* CHART_AXIS_COLUMN and 0..* CHART_FILTER (see these table for more informations). It may be referenced by either a CHART_DEFINITION (as a query), either a COLUMN_PROTOTYPE (as a subquery).

column.name: NAME
column.remarks: internal usage, when this CHART_QUERY is a CHART_COLUMN_PROTOTYPE subquery the name helps identify which one

changeSet.comment: The table CHART_DEFINITION describes the custom charts created by the user. Along with the informations stored in this table a CHART_DEFINITION refers to a CHART_QUERY, which aggregates the unit blocks that constitute the data elligible for plotting.

column.name: USER_ID
column.remarks: foreign key to the owner of this chart definition

column.name: CHART_TYPE
column.remarks: whether this chart is a 'PIE', 'BAR' etc

changeSet.comment:
This table holds referential data only (users cannot populate it) : it lists every single columns that can be used in a custom chart. Here, a column is basically an attribute from an entity. Theses columns are merely options proposed to the user. Once the user confirmed that he wants to include a particular column in a custom chart, and in which context (as a measure, an axis or applying a filter on it), the entries from this table will be referenced by entries in tables FILTER, AXIS_COLUMN or MEASURE_COLUMN.
Some columns aren't proper attributes of an entity but rather the result of an expression. This expression is itself expressed as a CHART_QUERY. For this reason a COLUMN_PROTOTYPE may point to a CHART_QUERY via a (nullable) foreign key.

column.name: SUBQUERY_ID
column.remarks: optional foreign key to a (sub) CHART_QUERY

column.name: LABEL
column.remarks: The default label for this column.

column.name: ENTITY_TYPE
column.remarks: The kind of entities this column belongs to

column.name: ATTRIBUTE_NAME
column.remarks: The name of the attribute of the entity

column.name: ATTRIBUTE_TYPE
column.remarks: complementary information about the nature of this column : native attribute ('ATTRIBUTE'), computed field ('CALCULATED') - often as a subquery -, or custom field ('CUF')

changeSet.comment: The CHART_COLUMN_ROLES precises in which roles a particular CHART_COLUMN_PROTOTYPE can be used : 'AXIS', 'FILTER' or 'MEASURE'.

column.name: ROLE
column.remarks: name of a role for the referenced column

changeSet.comment: This table store which columns are the measures the user is interested to see. They consists of an aggregation operation applied to a CHART_COLUMN_PROTOTYPE.

column.name: CHART_COLUMN_ID
column.remarks: foreign key to the CHART_COLUMN_PROTOTYPE this measure applies to

column.name: LABEL
column.remarks: a label for this measure. Will override the default label of the column prototype if non null.

column.name: MEASURE_OPERATION
column.remarks: the measure applied to the column

column.name: MEASURE_RANK
column.remarks: the order in which the measure will be displayed when the chart is rendered.

changeSet.comment: A CHART_FILTER restricts the values a CHART_COLUMN_PROTOTYPE may have for a given chart. A CHART_FILTER will compare the value of a CHART_COLUMN_PROTOTYPE with one or several CHART_FILTER_VALUES using a comparison operator.
This table holds the values used in a CHART_FILTER.
This table holds which CHART_COLUMN_PROTOTYPE are the axes for a given chart.

column.name: LABEL
column.remarks: a label for this axis. If non null, will override the default label in the CHART_COLUMN_PROTOTYPE

column.name: AXIS_OPERATION
column.remarks: may define an additional operation about how data are grouped on this axis, most of the time 'NONE' is fine, however for Timestamp columns an adequate aggregation (day, month etc) may be useful

column.name: AXIS_RANK
column.remarks: in which order the axis are processed (if relevant)

changeSet.comment: The scope is a particular filter on the data : it restrict the perimeter from which the measured entities can be chosen, for example from project X and folder Y

column.name: ENTITY_REFERENCE_TYPE
column.remarks: the type of the referenced entity

column.name: ENTITY_REFERENCE_ID
column.remarks: the id of the referenced entity
